title: Singer Cardi B Pleads Not Guilty in Alleged N.Y. Strip-Club Attack
summary: The Grammy winner is accused of being involved with attacks on two female bartenders in 2018. Grammy-winning artist Cardi B pleaded not guilty Tuesday to felony and misdemeanor charges over her alleged role in two premeditated attacks on bartenders at a Queens strip club in 2018.

title: St. Louis Fed's Bullard Said He Was Contacted by White House for Fed Board Job
summary: Bullard called the discussions 'exploratory in nature'. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said Tuesday he has been approached by White House officials "in recent months" about the possibility of serving on the Fed's board of governors.

title: Judge to Review Motive of Trump Administration Census Citizenship Question
summary: Documents found on computer drives of GOP strategist Thomas Hofeller considered potentially relevant. A federal appeals court ordered a judge to review allegations the Trump administration added a citizenship question to the 2020 census intending to skew political power toward whites and Republicans.

title: Justice Department Investigates Chicken Industry
summary: Retailers, restaurants say producers including Tyson, Pilgrim's colluded to boost prices; meat companies deny claims. The U.S. Justice Department has launched a criminal investigation into allegations that top poultry processors colluded to keep prices artificially high.

title: The Democratic Opportunity
summary: Can Biden withstand the left's assault? Plus, Warren vs. Sanders.. The Democratic presidential candidates open their primary debate season Wednesday night in Miami with an historic opportunity: They have an excellent chance to retake the White House against a first-term incumbent if they can nominate a candidate who doesn't frighten the swing voters who have doubts about Donald Trump.

title: Blasts Probed in Brazil Dam Burst
summary: Police official says he is investigating whether mining detonations triggered deadly January collapse. SÃO PAULO-Brazil's chief police officer looking into the collapse of Vale SA's dam in January said he was investigating whether detonations carried out by the mining company that day could have triggered the disaster, which killed about 270 people.

title: D.C. Squeezes Charters
summary: A high performing charter is rewarded with an eviction notice.. The Washington, D.C. City Council on Wednesday is meeting to discuss charter schools. Let's hope someone asks Mayor Muriel Bowser why her administration is denying space to charters-at the same time it plans to spend millions to refurbish under-utilized traditional schools.

title: U.S., Iran Step Up Rhetoric After Washington's Sanctions Threat
summary: U.S. officials and international leaders work toward talks aimed at defusing the conflict at a global summit this week. President Trump and President Hassan Rouhani of Iran shifted back to a sharply confrontational footing on Tuesday, trading accusations while U.S. officials and international leaders worked toward expected talks aimed at defusing the conflict at a global summit at the end of the week.

title: Europe Starts to Lose Its Nerve on Russia
summary: What would we do without 'human-rights' organizations?. The U.S. often gets knocked for its skepticism of multilateral institutions, but these groups often prove America's point. See the news that Russia is being welcomed back to the Council of Europe, which calls itself "the continent's leading human rights organisation."

title: Tax Reform's Remedy for Outsourcing
summary: The AbbVie-Allergan tie is a bet on innovation, not tax arbitrage.. Like other recent pharmaceutical tie-ups, AbbVie 's proposed merger with Dublin-based Allergan announced Tuesday is driven by the need to innovate amid increasing competition. This is a welcome change from the Obama years when drug makers were trying to merge with foreign firms to mitigate America's uncompetitive corporate tax rate.

title: Should the Government Regulate Social Media?
summary: Students debate regulating social media-scrub hate speech, make moderation neutral, or leave well enough alone?. Editor's note: This Future View is about government regulation of social media. Next time we'll ask: Why do you think young adults appear to be increasingly uninterested in religion? The number of Americans 18 to 34 who never attend religious services has more than doubled since 2000 to 36%, according to the latest Wall Street Journal/NBC News poll. Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before July 9. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Buyer Makes a Big Bet His New Caravaggio Is Really by Caravaggio
summary: Experts are split over the authenticity of the long-lost work, but an anonymous buyer is a believer. Michelangelo Merisi, the artist known as Caravaggio, always drew trouble.

title: Trump Administration to Take on Local Housing Barriers
summary: President signs order creating White House Council on Eliminating Barriers to Affordable Housing Development. The Trump administration will explore using federal programs to push local governments to soften or eliminate rules that block housing construction, an issue that has stymied officials at all levels of government for years.

title: Saudis Say Yemeni Islamic State Leader Captured
summary: Raid on June 3 used U.S. intelligence to seize group's leaders and weapons. CAIRO-Saudi and Yemeni special forces captured the man they identified as the leader of Islamic State's branch in Yemen this month in a raid aided by elite U.S. forces and American intelligence, Saudi and American officials said.

title: Democrats and Affluent Suburbs Join to Fight Tax-Break Cap
summary: Odd moments in congressional debate as House Democrats argue in favor of tax-code change that would primarily benefit high-income households. WASHINGTON-The familiar politics of taxation-in which Democrats push to raise taxes on high-income people and Republicans resist-turned topsy-turvy Tuesday.

title: Fed's Barkin Takes Wait-and-See Approach to Rate Setting
summary: Faced with mixed economic data, Richmond central bank leader says future data would help determine whether to cut interest rates this year. OTTAWA-Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Thomas Barkin said he doesn't know whether a rate cut would be needed this year, as officials grapple with mixed economic data and uncertainty over U.S. trade policies.

title: Marijuana Activists Pass Their High Point
summary: They thought 2019 would be a year of nationwide triumph. Instead, the backlash has begun.. This was supposed to be the year full cannabis legalization in the U.S. moved much closer to being a reality. Instead it has been a disaster for advocates. Although Illinois legalized recreational use on the final day of its legislative schedule, a half-dozen other deep-blue states that were expected to legalize failed to follow-including New York.

title: 'Why Cities Lose' Review: Where Politics Meets Geography
summary: Reliably liberal voters are usually clustered together more tightly than their conservative opponents, a problem for the Democratic Party.. Why have American politics become so polarized? One reason is that in recent years, while Democratic politicians have increased their dominance in urban areas ever further, the traditional rural support base for Democratic candidates in Appalachia and the South has collapsed. Conservative "blue dog" Democrats are nearly extinct.

title: Trump's Poll Numbers Prove Character Counts
summary: Americans give him low marks on personal qualities and discount the strong economy.. Today's political landscape presents an incongruous scene: Despite a strong economy-usually a good predictor of presidential popularity-President Trump's approval rating remains stuck in the low to mid-40s.

title: Trump's Finest Hour
summary: Even his supporters appreciate that he's not a president for all seasons.. You go to war with the president you have, not the one you might like to have.

title: Warren vs. Warren on Government Day Care
summary: As a professor, she questioned a liberal 'sacred cow.'. Sen. Elizabeth Warren last week introduced the Universal Child Care and Early Learning Act, which would establish a network of federally subsidized and regulated day-care centers. The problem with this proposal is that it's bad for children.

title: Congress Emboldens Iran in the Name of Peace in Yemen
summary: Instead, condemn the Houthis for human-rights violations and demand they observe a cease-fire.. With tensions escalating in the Middle East, Congress is emboldening Iran by sending the wrong message about Yemen. Last week the Senate voted to halt military sales to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates. Earlier this year, President Trump was forced to veto a congressional resolution aimed at ending U.S. assistance to the Saudi-led coalition in Yemen. Congress evidently can't separate its response to the killing of Jamal Khashoggi from the threats posed by the Houthis, Iranians and terrorists in Yemen. This is no time to be sending mixed messages to Tehran.

title: Notable & Quotable: No More Trump for Knitters
summary: 'We cannot provide a space that is inclusive of all and also allow support for open white supremacy.'. A June 23 announcement on Ravelry.com, "a free site for knitters and crocheters":

title: Hate Crime Hoaxes Are More Common Than You Think
summary: A political scientist found that fewer than 1 in 3 of 346 such allegations was genuine.. When I asked Wilfred Reilly about last week's appointment of a special prosecutor in Chicago to take up the Jussie Smollett case, he was cautiously optimistic. Mr. Reilly is author of a new book, "Hate Crime Hoax," in which he details how the initial publicity for supposed hate crimes tends all but to disappear if the allegations are exposed as fake.

title: San Francisco Passes Ban on E-Cigarette Sales
summary: Ban, which mayor needs to sign, is first of its kind in U.S.. San Francisco's Board of Supervisors passed the first blanket ban on e-cigarette sales in the U.S. on Tuesday.

title: House Panel Advances Robocall Bill
summary: Phone carriers would be required to prevent misleading modification of caller ID information. A bill that would protect consumers from robocalls came closer to passage Tuesday after a House subcommittee moved it forward with amendments addressing fraud.

title: Huawei Gear Far More Vulnerable to Hackers Than That of Rivals, Report Says
summary: Top U.S. officials say research confirms fears of risks, but report stops short of accusing the company of deliberately building flaws into system. WASHINGTON-Telecommunications gear made by China's Huawei Technologies Co. is far more likely to contain flaws that could be leveraged by hackers for malicious use than equipment from rival companies, according to new research by cybersecurity experts that top U.S. officials said appeared credible.

title: Stocks Fall Amid Fed Comments; Tech Slides
summary: Investors, looking for a tell on where interest rates are headed, parsed the latest comments from Fed officials. U.S. stocks fell, as investors weighed commentary from Federal Reserve officials and shares of technology companies slumped.

title: Merrill Lynch Commodities to Pay $25 Million to Resolve Government Investigation
summary: Justice Department said some Merrill Lynch precious metals traders placed fraudulent orders between 2008 and 2014. The U.S. Department of Justice on Tuesday said Merrill Lynch Commodities Inc. will pay $25 million to resolve a government investigation looking into a "multiyear scheme by MLCI precious metals traders to mislead the market for precious metals futures contracts traded on the Commodity Exchange Inc."

title: Micron Has Resumed Shipments to Huawei in Past Two Weeks
summary: Micron had suspended shipments after U.S. curbed sales to Huawei in May. Micron Technology Inc. has resumed some shipments to Huawei Technologies Co. after determining that they didn't fall afoul of U.S. curbs on exports to the Chinese telecom giant, the memory chip maker's chief executive said Tuesday.

title: Powell Says Fed Won't Bend to Political Pressure
summary: Trade uncertainty, global growth worries could prompt rate cuts. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell pushed back against President Trump's repeated demands for lower interest rates-citing the central bank's decadeslong independence-while explaining why it might nevertheless cut interest rates soon.

title: Judge Allows Lawsuit by Democrats Against Trump to Proceed
summary: Fact-finding can proceed in suit alleging Trump's ownership of private companies that accept foreign government business may violate Emoluments Clause. WASHINGTON-A federal judge on Tuesday ruled that a lawsuit brought by congressional Democrats against President Trump can proceed, clearing the way for lawmakers to begin obtaining records from businesses owned by the president.

title: Is There a Big Short in Bitcoin?
summary: Trading activity has grown in CME's bitcoin futures in recent months, along with the rebound in the cryptocurrency's price. Hedge funds and other big traders are betting that bitcoin will fall, even as the digital currency has risen above $11,000 on a new wave of crypto-optimism.

title: Port Authority Plans Toll, Fare Hikes on Crossings and PATH Train
summary: Agency officials also want new fees on taxis and for-hire vehicles at airports. The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey on Tuesday said it would seek to raise fares and tolls across its bridges and tunnels and on the PATH rail system, and propose a new fee on taxis and for-hire vehicles at airports.

title: 'The Life of Animals in Japanese Art' Review: From Adorable to Fearsome
summary: The delightful, wide-ranging exhibition at Washington's National Gallery attests to Japanese artists' long history of paying homage to animals in their work.. Washington

title: Deutsche Bank's Equities Chief Expected to Leave
summary: Peter Selman, global head of equities, has indicated he plans to leave after executives discussed a possible role for him in a planned bad bank. Deutsche Bank AG's global head of equities is expected to leave, the latest move in a planned downsizing of the German lender's investment bank, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Energy Stocks Diverge From Oil Prices
summary: Oil-field services companies have been among hardest hit groups within S&P 500's energy sector. Energy shares are sliding this week despite oil's climb-a divergence some analysts say could linger if geopolitical tensions in the Middle East continue to escalate.

title: Push to Overhaul Fannie, Freddie Nudges Up Mortgage Costs
summary: Some investors are wary that any big changes could reduce or eliminate the federal backstop.

title: Behind Spate of Drug Deals, the Need for Short-Term Growth
summary: Questions remain about whether the transactions will lead to long-term growth. Pricing pressures and patent expirations for top-selling drugs are opening up opportunities for pharmaceutical companies to make major deals at relatively bargain prices. But questions remain about whether the transactions will lead to long-term growth.

title: Nestlé, Novartis Among Companies at Risk of London Trading Ban
summary: Political dispute between EU and Switzerland threatens to tip over into markets. ZURICH-Trading in Switzerland's biggest blue-chip companies could soon be banned in London and other major financial centers, as a political dispute with the European Union threatens to spill over into markets.

title: Treasury Yields Decline Following Weak Economic Data
summary: Yield on 10-year Treasury falls to lowest level in more than 2 ½ years. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note fell to its lowest level in more than 2½ years Tuesday after weak U.S. economic data bolstered the case for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in coming months.

title: Gold Rally Picks Up Steam as Investors Pile In
summary: The price of the precious metal is heading toward a fresh six-year high. The price of gold is rising at the quickest pace in years, illustrating the extent to which global investors are anticipating lower interest rates around the world and seeking alternatives to bonds and currencies.

title: New Jersey Task Force Subpoenas Firms That Got Tax Credits
summary: The records request follows an initial report that found evidence of potential fraud. A task force examining New Jersey's corporate-incentive programs continues to zero in on a group of businesses with ties to political power broker George Norcross.

title: The Best Pinot Noirs Under $20: A Discriminating Guide
summary: Why is it so hard to find a good bottle of Pinot for a good price? Our wine columnist investigated-and actually managed to find a few bottles both affordable and quaffable. WHY IS IT SO HARD to find a reasonably priced Pinot Noir that actually tastes like the grape? That was the question that came to mind over and over again when I tasted a group of 16 Pinot Noirs that cost $20 a bottle or less.

title: Ligado's Wireless Plans Caught in 5G Agency Crossfire
summary: Wireless venture, running short on cash, urges FCC to ignore 'political noise' around 5G rollout. Ligado Networks LLC's plan to develop some of the nation's most valuable airwaves is being undercut by disagreements between U.S. regulators over the deployment of 5G technology-miring the company's business in a holding pattern and pressuring its finances.

title: Handcrafted Fashion: Why We Crave It in the Digital Age
summary: Techniques like crochet, all the rage in the 1960s fashion, are back in a big way in recent designs-and people are willing to pay big for them. WHEN DESIGNER Christopher Kane opened his fall 2011 show with a granny-square-crocheted ensemble, he was an outlier. Also, a harbinger. Eight years later, crochet projects are proliferating on Instagram, "yarn bombing"-a wool-based form of street graffiti-is a thing, and handicrafting helped define the spring collections. At European houses like Christian Dior and Loewe and American brands like Altuzarra and Ulla Johnson, techniques like crochet, macramé and knitting were dominant themes.

title: Medical Equipment Maker Joerns Seeks Bankruptcy Protection
summary: Private equity-backed business starts chapter 11 with plan to hand ownership to lenders and bondholders. Joerns Healthcare LLC, a medical equipment maker whose owners include private-equity firms Quad-C Management Inc. and Aurora Capital Partners, sought bankruptcy protection with a reorganization plan that would reduce its debt to $80 million from $400 million.

title: RealReal's Biggest Hurdle Will Be Keeping It Real After IPO
summary: Seller of used Gucci dresses and Rolex watches fights fake luxury goods; 20 hours to vet a necklace. As The RealReal Inc. prepares to go public this week, the online marketplace for used luxury goods faces a big challenge: weeding out the fakes.

title: Afghans Supported by U.S. Repel Taliban to Increase Leverage in Talks
summary: Retaking farming district of Khawja Umari is one attempt at shaping the political environment during the Doha peace negotiations. KHAWJA UMARI, Afghanistan-A semblance of peace has returned to this luxuriantly green farm district in southeastern Afghanistan. Farmers tend potato fields and grape vineyards lined by rows of poplar and copses of birch trees. A half-dozen boys sit atop the cement wall of an irrigation canal rushing with water, whiling away the hot, dry afternoon.

title: Europe Lifts Russia's Suspension From Human-Rights Body
summary: Council of Europe had suspended the country after its annexation of Crimea in 2014; Ukraine president criticizes move. BRUSSELS-European lawmakers voted to end Russia's suspension from the Continent's main human-rights organization, provoking dismay in Ukraine, where Russia is pursuing a covert war that has left more than 13,000 dead.

title: Consortium of Tech Firms Sets AI Benchmarks
summary: Metrics cover AI performance in image recognition, object detection and voice translation. A consortium of tech companies, including Facebook Inc. and Alphabet Inc.'s Google, has released a set of benchmarks for evaluating the performance of artificial-intelligence tools, aiming to help businesses navigate the fast-growing field.

title: The Continuing Wound of Central Park Rape
summary: No one (except the five men themselves) will ever know what they did, either individually or as a group, that night. But we do know what they didn't do. They didn't rape the female jogger, which is the crime for which they were tried and convicted.. Linda Fairstein's "Netflix's False Story of the Central Park Five" (op-ed, June 11) tries to turn our attention away from the real issue and toward "the larger picture of that terrible night" to defend her reputation. No one (except the five men themselves) will ever know what they did, either individually or as a group, that night. But we do know what they didn't do. They didn't rape the female jogger, which is the crime for which they were tried and convicted. Ms. Fairstein should accept responsibility for the role she played in this gross miscarriage of justice that destroyed the lives of these boys because of their incarceration. As has been suggested, someone should take a look at the other cases she was involved in and determine why there was no investigation into her actions when the five men were exonerated.

title: Disability Insurance Can Be a Real Lifesaver
summary: In a cruel irony, I am now receiving disability payments as I battle bone-marrow cancer, a disease that cost me my career and my income. Were it not for my DI coverage, my family would be facing a financial crisis.. During most of my 31-year insurance career, I tried to convince people of the need for disability income insurance (DI). If you get sick or injured and can no longer work, DI is designed to replace a big chunk of your lost income. In a cruel irony, I am now receiving disability payments as I battle bone-marrow cancer, a disease that cost me my career and my income. Were it not for my DI coverage, my family would be facing a financial crisis.

title: Impossible to Protect Ever-Expanding Rights
summary: The notion of human rights is undermined by the assertion that practically anything can be a human right. If everything is a human right, then nothing is. Thug states get this.. In "Pompeo Tries to Rescue the Idea of Human Rights" (op-ed, June 11) on Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's proposed U.S. Commission on Unalienable Rights, Aaron Rhodes is correct that the international emphasis on economic and social rights have undermined political and civil rights and ushered in a new generation of identity rights that actually threaten freedom.

title: Turks Should Face the Past, as Germans Have
summary: What happened to the Armenian people was not reasonable-it was genocide. There is no "significant debate.". In his June 14 letter regarding Christian deaths in Turkey, Turkish Ambassador Serdar Kiliç points out that Holocaust survivor and human-rights champion Raphael Lemkin coined the word genocide, but he fails to note that Lemkin cited the horrors endured by the Armenian and Jewish people as prototypes of genocide. This follows what U.S. Ambassador to the Ottoman Empire Henry Morgenthau described in 1915 as a "campaign of race extermination," and not as Ambassador Kiliç would like readers to believe, a relocation of "many Armenians" to the south. Ambassador Kiliç also fails to mention that this past April, on the anniversary of the Armenian Genocide, Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdogan justified what took place as "reasonable" at the time.

title: Just Move Wright's Cottage
summary: Instead of bulldozing the cottage, why not it where someone wants it?. Regarding Michael J. Lewis's "Frank Lloyd Wright's Booth Cottage: Bulldozing a Modernist Landmark" (Life & Arts, Cultural Commentary, June 24): Instead of bulldozing the cottage or leaving it where its owner no longer wants it, why not jack it off its foundation and move it where someone does want it? This was and continues to be the Chicago way, and it makes for great photographs.

title: Jared Kushner Pushes Trump Peace Plan in Bahrain
summary: Israelis and Palestinians have 'opportunity of the century,' Trump's son-in-law tells conference. MANAMA, Bahrain-President Trump's senior adviser and son-in-law Jared Kushner sought to breathe life into the administration's foray into Middle East peacemaking Tuesday, imploring government officials and businesspeople to embrace the economic portion of a plan he called the "opportunity of the century."

title: PG&E Bondholders Propose $30 Billion Turnaround Plan
summary: Wall Street offers a way out of bankruptcy for embattled California utility. PG&E Corp. bondholders have challenged the California utility over control of its bankruptcy proceeding, offering Wall Street's version of a solution to wildfire liabilities estimated at $30 billion or more.

title: GOP Lawmaker Accused of Using Campaign Funds to Pay for Trysts
summary: Rep. Duncan Hunter says he plans to fight charges at trial; his wife pleaded guilty earlier this month. WASHINGTON-Rep. Duncan Hunter used campaign funds to pursue affairs with three lobbyists and two congressional aides, including a member of his own staff, federal prosecutors alleged in documents filed this week.

title: Opera Theatre of Saint Louis Review: Wrenching Drama and Vicious Satire
summary: The world premiere of Terence Blanchard's searing "Fire Shut Up In My Bones"; a remarkably modern production of Monteverdi's "The Coronation of Poppea"; a generic take on Verdi's "Rigoletto.".

title: Grisham Named White House Press Secretary, Communications Director
summary: Melania Trump's communications chief will take over for Sarah Sanders. WASHINGTON-Stephanie Grisham, the first lady's communications director, will serve as the next White House press secretary and communications director, Melania Trump said Tuesday.

title: Unidentified Buyer Adds to the Caravaggio Mystery
summary: An unidentified collector bought a possible Caravaggio, pre-empting the first auction of a painting said to be by the Italian Baroque master in at least 40 years. The first auction of a possible Caravaggio in at least 40 years took on even more mystery on Monday, when the sale-set for Thursday-was canceled after a buyer snatched up the alleged work by the Baroque master.

title: Illinois Legalizes Recreational Marijuana
summary: State becomes 11th to do so; some 800,000 eligible for expunging of records for possession of less than 1 ounce. SPRINGFIELD, Ill.-Illinois's new governor delivered on a top campaign promise Tuesday by signing legislation legalizing small amounts of marijuana for recreational use, making the state the 11th to do so and the first to implement a comprehensive statewide cannabis marketplace designed by legislators.

title: U.S. Deficits Expected to Continue Growing
summary: Congressional Budget Office says trend, though slightly eased, is a significant risk for the nation. WASHINGTON-Annual U.S. budget deficits are on track to more than double as a share of the economy, though not as much as previously thought, in a trend the Congressional Budget Office said is a significant risk for the nation.

title: Consumer Confidence Slid in June on Trade Tensions
summary: A gauge of consumer sentiment deteriorated in June to its lowest level in nearly two years. U.S. optimism about the economy deteriorated in June to its lowest level in 21 months as consumers fretted over escalating trade tensions and a cooling jobs market, according to a monthly barometer of Americans' mood.

title: Ex-UBS Compliance Officer and Day Trader Found Guilty of Insider Trading
summary: U.K. jury finds Fabiana Abdel-Malek and Walid Choucair guilty on three charges; deliberations continue on two other charges. A U.K. jury convicted a former UBS Group AG compliance officer and a wealthy trader of insider trading on Tuesday.

title: EU Expands Its Stack of Trade Deals
summary: Europe adds pact with Vietnam to its collection, countering wave of protectionism. BRUSSELS-The European Union is building a free-trade coalition of the willing, one deal at a time.

title: China's Consumers Turn Cautious, Weakening President Xi's Hand
summary: Signs of tepid demand for autos and apartments undercut Beijing's plan to rely on consumer spending for economic growth. SHANGHAI-Evidence is piling up that Chinese consumer spending alone won't be enough to power the country's economy past its trade trouble with the U.S.

title: Mitsubishi to Acquire Bombardier's Regional Jet Unit
summary: Deal marks Canadian company's exit from passenger aircraft business after struggling to compete with Airbus, Boeing. Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd. said it would acquire Bombardier Inc.'s regional-jet business for $550 million in a transaction that puts the companies on different paths in the aviation sector.

title: Stock Exchanges Accuse Government of Ethics Lapse in Market-Data Fight
summary: NYSE, Nasdaq say senior SEC official Brett Redfearn has ethical conflicts because of prior Wall Street work. The New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq Inc. on Monday accused a senior regulator who supervises them of having ethical conflicts, raising the ante in a battle with Washington over how the companies sell market data.

title: Sagging Trade Flows Spark Alarm Before G-20 Meeting
summary: If tit-for-tat measures continue, tariffs could rise back to 2003 levels, economists warn. Higher U.S. tariffs and other trade barriers have hit world trade flows, presenting a challenge for leaders from the Group of 20 large economies preparing to meet in Japan.

title: Home Prices Decelerated in April
summary: Average prices still continue to increase in most major U.S. cities and to outpace inflation. The growth of U.S. home prices continued to slow in April in another sign of a weaker-than-expected selling season.

title: YouTube Content for Children Should Be Barred, Advocacy Groups Tell FTC
summary: The pair of parent organizations, which filed a complaint against Google and YouTube over privacy concerns, are calling for billions of dollars in fines. WASHINGTON-Privacy advocates are calling on the Federal Trade Commission to remove all YouTube content directed at kids and impose tens of billions in fines against the video-streaming service run by Alphabet Inc.'s Google unit for alleged children's privacy violations.

title: Is Cryptocurrency Ready for Stephen Moore?
summary: Pundit didn't get onto the Fed board but has joined a 'decentralized central bank' that hopes to tame cryptocurrencies like bitcoin. If you can't beat 'em, join 'em. And if you can't join 'em?

title: U.S. New-Home Sales Fell in May
summary: Purchases of newly built single-family homes dropped 7.8%, a sign the housing sector remains on uneven footing. WASHINGTON-Americans purchased fewer new homes in May, a sign the housing sector remains on somewhat uneven footing.

title: UnitedHealth Buys PatientsLikeMe After Startup Was Forced to Divest Chinese Investment
summary: Deal for company that connects people with similar health conditions reflects industry's appetite for patient data. UnitedHealth Group Inc. bought PatientsLikeMe, a company that helps connect people who have similar health conditions, after the startup was forced to divest an investment by a Chinese firm.

title: The New Labor Movement: Pushing Employers to Be Socially Active
summary: Workers are banding together to influence their company's policies toward the environment and social issues. In the 20th century, labor activists fought for higher pay and better working conditions. These days, many workers are pressuring management to become better corporate citizens.

title: AbbVie and Big Pharma: No Miracle Cures
summary: Investors aren't pleased with AbbVie's $63 billion purchase of Allergan, but industry dynamics demand unpopular megadeals. AbbVie shareholders have clamored for diversification away from the world's best-selling drug. On Tuesday, they found out that diversification comes with a big cost.

title: Foreign Investing in Chinese Commercial Property Hits New High
summary: Institutional investors bought $2.7 billion worth of Chinese commercial real estate in the first quarter.

title: Debates Put DNC Back in the Spotlight
summary: After taking heat in 2016, the DNC is again a foil for some presidential candidates. WASHINGTON-The Democratic National Committee, having served as a punching bag for disaffected liberals in 2016, is preparing to step back into the ring. It still has some bruises.

title: Former Prisoners of War Sue North Korean Leader
summary: South Koreans who labored in regime's coal mines seek damages from Kim Jong Un. SEOUL-After years working in North Korean coal mines, two former prisoners of war are seeking nearly $300,000 in damages from an unlikely source: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.

title: Booking.com Takes a Slice of Hotels' Lucrative Resort Fees
summary: Hotel industry is vowing to fight back against the new commission charges. Resort fees are becoming so ubiquitous that some online travel sites are looking to cash in on them.

title: New Staten Island Outlet Mall Buoyed by Ferry Tourists and Locals
summary: Formerly a parking lot near the boat terminal, the $650 million complex offers an expansive promenade with spectacular Manhattan views. title: Madhur Jaffrey Is Equal Parts Actress and Culinary Writer
summary: The award-winning film star and author pursued a life in front of the camera, and also whipped up more than 30 Indian cookbooks. Madhur Jaffrey, 85, is an award-winning actress and the author of more than 30 cookbooks, seven of which received James Beard awards. Her latest book is "Madhur Jaffrey's Instantly Indian Cookbook" (Knopf). She spoke with Marc Myers.

title: GE Reaches Labor Deal With Union Leaders
summary: Tentative four-year agreement covers about 6,600 U.S. workers. General Electric Co. has reached a tentative four-year agreement with a group of unions after a few weeks of negotiations, keeping a labor peace as the conglomerate restructures its operations.

title: The Loan That Fueled a Star Investor's Risky 'Illiquid' Bets
summary: Northern Trust lent to a fund of risky, hard-to-trade bets run by Neil Woodford, whose investment empire has stumbled in the face of client withdrawals and regulatory scrutiny. U.S. financial giant Northern Trust could be on the hook for losses related to the unraveling of a star U.K. fund manager, in a case that is drawing attention to the dangers of hard-to-sell assets hiding inside retail investment products.

title: Iran-Allied Houthis Expose Holes in Saudi Arabia's Missile Defense
summary: Rebels fighting Saudi-led coalition in Yemen have stepped up their attacks as the U.S.-Iran confrontation has escalated. CAIRO-Yemen's Houthi rebels have accelerated missile and drone attacks on Saudi Arabia in recent weeks, highlighting the kingdom's military vulnerabilities in defending itself against an Iranian ally amid a crisis in U.S.-Iran relations.

title: Battle at Bathroom Company Ends With Ex-CEO's Return
summary: Activist shareholders help ousted CEO of Japan's Lixil Group achieve a rare comeback. TOKYO-In a rare corporate comeback, the ousted chief executive of Lixil Group Corp. recovered his job at the Japanese bath and kitchen company with the support of some foreign activist shareholders.

title: U.S. Steel Seeks to Make More With Fewer Furnaces
summary: Giant metal maker aims to increase shipments despite idling plants while it conducts $1.5 billion in repairs. Falling steel prices are adding pressure to United States Steel Corp.'s plan to get better performance from its mills by making overdue repairs and equipment upgrades.

title: Her Love of Cars Starts With a Porsche Named Sally
summary: Resume Subscription. Caroline Ecklin, 27, manager of Horsepower Enterprises, a car restoration shop in Lancaster, Pa., and author of the ChicMoto blog, on her and her father's 1980 Porsche 911 SC, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: When Patients Can't Pay, Many Hospitals Are Suing
summary: Politicians want to rein in aggressive tactics used by nonprofit hospitals to collect unpaid bills, including suits and garnishing of wages.

title: Photos: A Car Blogger's Porsche Preoccupation
summary: This 1980 911 SC inspired by an animated character from a Pixar movie has extra meaning for the family that owns it. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Stocks to Watch: AbbVie, Allergan, FedEx, Tesla, FactSet Research Systems
summary: Shares of energy companies will also be in focus. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Tuesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Missouri and Kansas Near Cease-Fire Deal Over Incentives
summary: Agreement aims to ban tax breaks for companies that change addresses in greater Kansas City. Kansas and Missouri are nearing a truce in an economic border war that has cost hundreds of millions of dollars and created barely any new jobs.

title: Companies Win-Somewhat-as Treasury Trims Reach of Minimum Tax
summary: Proposed rules would help U.S.-based businesses with operations in high-tax countries. Businesses are getting help-but not everything they wanted-as the Treasury Department addresses one of the biggest corporate frustrations with the 2017 tax law.

title: A New Road for Electric Vehicles in China
summary: Beijing is welcoming back previously blacklisted foreign battery giants in an effort to recharge its electric-vehicle industry. China is opening up a key part of its electric-vehicle industry to global competition. The move could, paradoxically, make it stronger.

title: Biggest U.S. Companies' Working-Capital Performance Hits Six-Year High
summary: Inventories fall for the 1,000 largest public companies, a Hackett Group study finds. U.S. companies' working-capital efficiency reached a six-year high in 2018 as finance chiefs increasingly prioritize managing inventories to more quickly convert the capital into cash, a new study found.

title: Coming to London: Yankees vs. Red Sox vs. the Great British Summer
summary: Baseball is hoping to develop a fan base in a country that will have you know that it much prefers bowlers and wicket-keepers to pitchers and catchers. LONDON-Over the past 20 years, baseball has dealt with the steroid crisis, declining attendance and the rise of literally every other sport in the U.S. Now, America's pastime must tackle its stiffest opponent since it butchered cricket: the Great British Summer.

title: Nissan Shareholders Accuse Renault Chairman of Betrayal at Fiery Meeting
summary: Japanese auto maker overhauls board at a meeting where shareholders shouted at current board members, management and each other. TOKYO-Jean-Dominique Senard showed up at Nissan Motor Co. 's annual shareholder meeting on Tuesday in a Toyota-and the proceedings only got rockier from there.

title: Warehouse Design Steals a Page From Tech Playbook
summary: Amenities born in Silicon Valley begin popping up in warehouses as e-commerce companies face tight labor market. Coffee bars, lounges and other creature-comforts that have become regular features of modern office spaces are beginning to make their way to warehouses.

title: Facebook's Pricey Ad Spend May Not Impress
summary: Third-party data shows declining time spent on Facebook and Instagram among U.S. users despite name recognition. Facebook plans to spend big to revamp its image with users. But while the social media giant has made its fortune selling other companies' ads, its own brand investments may not pay off.

title: Video Assistant Referee Technology Grinds the Women's World Cup to a Halt
summary: The tournament isn't even through the round of 16 and has already seen more VAR stoppages than the entire men's tournament in 2018. REIMS, France-The U.S. national team spent the most important moment of its World Cup so far standing around, hands on hips, while a Hungarian official stared at a television monitor. Fans waited in the sweltering heat for a cue to cheer or boo. The entire Women's World Cup seemed to grind to a halt.

title: Olympic Games Are Getting More Competitive for Advertisers
summary: An unusual $3 billion sponsorship deal inked by Coca-Cola and a Chinese dairy company shows how the Olympic Games remain a coveted ad platform. The Olympic Games remain advertising gold-so much so that exclusive sponsorship deals are becoming much costlier for the world's most powerful companies.

title: For Two Men With Autism, 1,000 Miles Apart, Gaming Was a Portal to Friendship
summary: Socially isolated and fearful of making friends, two buddies meet in a videogame chat app. Chris Lopes and Caleb Stephens didn't have many friends for years. Growing up 1,000 miles apart, the two had been diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder when they were younger and always found social interactions uncomfortable. The exception, for both, had been their brothers. But they both lost their brothers, and the only real friendships they'd had.

title: EPA Rule Would Have Impact Beyond Smokestacks
summary: Plan to roll back mandates on power plants-likely to face legal challenges-could set precedent that curtails future regulation. WASHINGTON-The Environmental Protection Agency's decision to scrap Obama-era climate rules for coal-power plants will have far-reaching repercussions if the move withstands legal challenges, advocates on both sides of the issue say.

title: U.S. Airlines, After Rebuilding Home Networks, Look to Expand Overseas
summary: Carriers are reversing years of under-investment in international routes to tackle their declining market share. U.S. airlines are rediscovering the rest of the world after years of ceding market share to rivals and international partners on overseas flights.

title: FedEx Profit Pressured by Express Unit's Woes
summary: Delivery giant says global trade uncertainty, macroeconomic weakness will continue to hurt profits. FedEx Corp. said its profit was squeezed in its most recent quarter as a global slowdown in trade and a shift by customers to slower and cheaper delivery options continued to weigh on its core Express business.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Global Telecom Carriers Attacked by Suspected Chinese Hackers
summary: Attack targeted 20 people believed to have ties to China across Asia, Europe, Africa and Middle East, according to a cybersecurity firm report.

title: FedEx Sues Commerce Department Over Restrictions on Huawei
summary: Delivery giant, caught in U.S.-China feud, says it cannot police shipments. FedEx Corp. , after botching some deliveries for Huawei Technologies Co., filed a lawsuit Monday to stop the U.S. government from requiring the package giant to enforce a crackdown on the Chinese telecommunications-gear maker.

title: Top Democrat Presses White House on Putin Questions
summary: House Oversight chairman wants information about administration's preservation of records related to Trump's meetings with the Russian leader. WASHINGTON-The chairman of the House Oversight Committee in a letter to acting White House chief of staff Mick Mulvaney on Monday demanded an explanation for why the administration had failed to answer the panel's questions about its preservation of records related to President Trump's meetings with his Russian counterpart.

title: Toronto Officials Question Alphabet Unit's Ambitions for 'Smart City'
summary: Sidewalk Labs' plans for the neighborhood go beyond the initial scope, says government sponsor; 'very different perspectives'. TORONTO-A unit of Alphabet Inc. said its proposed "smart city" in a Toronto neighborhood would create thousands of jobs and cut greenhouse-gas emissions, but met some resistance from the project's government sponsor over the scope.

title: 'Fame' High School Principal Leaving Post After Student Protests
summary: Students and faculty say Lisa Mars hasn't prioritized the arts enough in her push for strong academics at the Manhattan public school. The principal of Manhattan's famous high school for the arts, known as LaGuardia, is leaving after protests by students and teachers saying she didn't prioritize the arts enough in her push for strong academics.
